data.title: Bishop Corletta J. Vaughn
data.text:
Bishop Dr. Corletta J. Vaughn is a graduate of Detroit Public Schools, (Bellevue Elementary, Miller Jr. High and Cass Technical High ’71). Wayne County Community College (A.A. Nursing) William Tyndale Bible College (B.R.E. Pastoral Studies) Oral Roberts University (M. Ed Administration and Curriculum Design), Christ for the Nations Theological Seminary (Doctor of Divinity, D.D.) and is currently a PhD candidate, Liberty University (Higher Education Administration).

Bishop Dr. Corletta J. Vaughn is the Senior Pastor of the Holy Ghost Cathedral Church of Detroit, Michigan and Presiding Bishop of Go Tell It Evangelistic Ministry, Worldwide Network of Churches. For more than 45 years, she has poured herself into the lives of congregations, schools, community organizations by uncompromised powerful preaching and teaching of the Word of God both nationally and internationally; bringing hope to the hopeless.

Her teaching affiliates:

Professor at Destiny University Tampa Florida. She serves as Dean, Roseville, MI

Founder and Chancellor of Kingdom and Faith Bible College in Detroit, Michigan, a licensed and accredited two-year school for ministers and church leaders.

President of International Institute of Expansion

Pentecostal Theological Seminary, Cleveland TN.

Her political and community engagement includes:

Council of Baptist Pastors of Detroit and Vicinity

Common Word Alliance Clergy Interfaith Organization and Ministry and Spirituality Centers for Humanity

Interfaith Leadership Council of Metropolitan Detroit

Past Precinct Delegate, 13th Congressional District

Faith-Based Media Surrogate for Democratic Presidential Candidate Hillary R. Clinton

Principal in NBC Oxygen Network Reality Show “Preachers of Detroit”

Faith-Based Initiatives, Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan

Elected DPSCD Board Member – 2019

Board Member Wayne RESA

Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. Lamba Pi Omega

Chapter Bishop Dr. Vaughn is the mother of two beautiful - gifted daughters, both DPS graduates; Shannon, an assistant Principal at Fraser High School, and Apprille, retired USN Chief and Chaplain.
